background_dashed.customLabel: In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of MELAT on Acceptability. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MELAT and controls on Adverse events. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 2 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MELAT and controls on Tolerability. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MELAT and controls on ADHD symptoms. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 2 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is a very strong effect in favor of  MELAT on Sleep quality. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is a very strong effect in favor of  MELAT on Sleep quantity. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 5 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  participants, there is no difference between MELAT and controls on Disruptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 2 clinical trials exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.
